sentences.en: A rust or prune juice in nasal discharge colour indicates blood originating from lower respiratory tract.
sentences.cn: 铁锈色或深紫红色鼻液表示血液来自下呼吸道.

sentences.en: Can you tell me whether it is a good thing to prune an apple tree?
sentences.cn: 你能否告诉我该不该修剪苹果树？

sentences.en: Compare clip, pare , prune , trim and shave.
sentences.cn: 试比较clip、pare 、 prune 、 trim、shave这几个词.

sentences.en: Fresh ripe black berries, very ripe prune jam and mocha.
sentences.cn: 新鲜成熟的黑色浆果, 非常成熟的修剪果酱和摩卡.

sentences.en: It is now the best time to prune.
sentences.cn: 现在是整枝的最好时节.

sentences.en: It is our job to prune the side branches of these trees.
sentences.cn: 我们的工作就是修剪这些树的侧枝.

sentences.en: Please prune plum trees promptly. The plum pickers plucked the plump plums.
sentences.cn: 请迅速修剪李子树. 摘李子的人摘下饱满了李子.

sentences.en: Prune rambling roses when the flowers have faded.
sentences.cn: 花朵凋谢后要剪除杂生的玫瑰枝。

sentences.en: Style: Full - bodied red wine, consistent black currant and dried prune taste.
sentences.cn: 风格: 酒体丰满, 具有集中的黑皮果实与巧克力的香气.

sentences.en: The company is pruning staff in order to reduce costs.
sentences.cn: 公司正在裁员以减少开支。

sentences.en: The original version of the text has been pruned quite a bit.
Try to prune your essay of irrelevant detail.
sentences.cn: 尽量删去你那文章中无关的细节.

sentences.en: Walnut trees that grow too large make it inconvenient to prune, spray, and harvest.
sentences.cn: 生长过大的核桃树,不便于修剪, 喷药和采收.

sentences.en: We talk talked week about when and how to prune plants.
sentences.cn: 上周我们谈到了该如何以及何时修剪植物的问题.

sentences.en: We talked last week about when and how to prune plants.
sentences.cn: 上周我们谈论了何时及如何给植物修剪枝条.

sentences.en: When should you prune apple trees?
sentences.cn: 苹果树应该什么时候剪枝？

sentences.en: Will you prune away the unnecessary adjectives in the passage?
sentences.cn: 把这段文字中不必要的形容词删去好 吗 ?

trans.tran_cn: 西梅脯，西梅干，深紫红色，傻瓜，〈美〉没趣的人，讨厌的人
trans.tran_en: a dried  plum  , often cooked before it is eaten
to cut off some of the branches of a tree or bush to make it grow better

trans.tran_cn: 修剪（树木等），删除，剪去，精简某事物，除去某事物多余的部分
trans.tran_en: to cut off some of the branches of a tree or bush to make it grow better
